DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate intervention aim reduce risk alcohol-exposed pregnancy prevent Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders Russian child . The study determine whether physician , train dual-focused brief motivational intervention monitor performance , foster great change knowledge , health belief , alcohol use , alcohol-exposed pregnancy risk Russian woman risk standard care .
DOC.detailed_description: The study two-arm , 20-site , site-randomized , controlled trial test intervention reduce risk alcohol-exposed pregnancy at-risk woman ( at-risk drinking childbearing age woman heterosexually active , consistently use contraception ) . The trial assess feasibility dual-focused ( i.e . contraception use-drinking reduction ) brief physician intervention ( DFBPI ) determine whether physician , train DFBPI monitor compliance , foster great reduction woman 's risk behavior compare standard care . The intervention specifically design deliverable routinely Obstetrics Gynecology physician ( OB/GYN ) large number woman woman 's clinic .
DOC.criteria: nonpregnant woman childbearing age ( 18 44 year age ) fertile risk alcoholexposed pregnancy : drinking atrisk ( 4 drink one occasion 7 drink per week ) last 3 month report unprotected intercourse least last 6 month unable comprehend interview question
